medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient describes abdominal pain as worse with eating, localized around the epigastric region with radiation towards the back and lower left chest. Symptoms have been present for one week, accompanied by "black-ish" and dark stools, with a few drops of bright red blood noted two days ago after a bowel movement. Last bowel movement was this morning. There has been minimal intermittent nausea without emesis. Patient reports a history of similar abdominal pains over the last year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: ETOH abuse (last drink 3 months ago), chronic abdominal pains, crack cocaine use (last used yesterday, using 2x week), s/p cholecystectomy, s/p appendectomy, previously told liver was "enlarged," tobacco use.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of lung cancer; no GI cancers or other GI diseases reported in family.
